ABOUT.WHO_WE_ARE_DESCRIPTION: The Mysore Electrical Industries Limited is a leading public sector undertaking of the Government of Karnataka and the first among the pioneers who have brought switchgear into India.
ABOUT.WHAT_WE_DO_DESCRIPTION: In the power generation and distribution scene, MEI has been making significant contribution with High Tension and Low Tension Switchgears for the past 7 decades.
ABOUT.HOW_WE_DO_DESCRIPTION: MEI have established a time tested and streamlined quality Assurance procedure. The staff engaged are highly experienced and competitive in stage inspection, inwards material inspection and testing and assembly inspection and Testing.
ABOUT.WHAT'S_NEW_DESCRIPTION: We have launched a new product -Compact RMU with Sulphur Hexaflouride(SF6) LBS & Vacuum Circuit Breaker with Distribution automation system (DAS)

PRODUCTS.CRMUSF6: COMPACT RMU WITH SF6 LBS & VCB

MEI.MOTTO: We are Professionals in Power Protection
MEI.WHY_MEI_DESCRIPTION: The company is self contained in respect of infrastructure and manufacturing facilities backed up by established Research and Development Division including Computer Circuit Breaker Analyzer, Computer Aided Design Center, Computer Aided planning well equipped testing division and a reputed Tool Room.

MAKE.HEADER: WE MAKE THINGS WHICH YOU FEEL PROUD
MAKE.TITLE: PRODUCTS & SPARES
MAKE.DESCRIPTION: All MEI products carry the hallmark of independent certification from foreign collaborators and CPRI’s at Bhopal and Bangalore. Today, after more than 60 years later , MEI’s products span the globe; Australia, Singapore , Kenya, Kuwait, Ceylon, Burma, Bahrain, Sudan, UAE, Cyprus and many other countries.

COMPANY_PROFILE.TITLE: The Mysore Electrical Industries Limited
COMPANY_PROFILE.DESCRIPTION_BOLD: MEI is a leading public sector undertaking of the Government of Karnataka and the first among the pioneers who have brought switchgear into India. The company was established in the year 1945, more than seven decades ago and is in the business of manufacturing high quality Switchgear, Motor Control Gears and Solid State Electronic relays and allied switchgear equipment i.e., Instrument Transformers used in switchgear and other industrial applications.
COMPANY_PROFILE.DESCRIPTION_NORMAL1: In the year 1945 the company entered into a collaboration with the British Company M/s. J.G. Statters and Company, for the manufacture of LT Oil Circuit Breaker up to 800 Amps. In the year 1956 this agreement was extended to cover Bulk Oil Circuit Breaker up to 12kV, 350MVA and 800 Amps, 12kV oil Fuse Switches and 12kV On-Load Oil Immersed Isolators. The company entered into an agreement with M/s. Stark storm of West Germany for the manufacturing of 10Amps and 25Amps LV Air-Break AC Contactors.
COMPANY_PROFILE.DESCRIPTION_NORMAL2: In 1955 the company negotiated an agreement with M/s Gardy, S.A., Geneva, Switzerland, for the manufacturing of their H.T and E.H.T Minimum Oil Content Circuit Breakers. The company has diversified its activities by designing and developing Solid State Relays within the Company for Power System Protection and Industrial applications.
COMPANY_PROFILE.DESCRIPTION_NORMAL3: In the year 1986 the company entered into a collaboration with M/s. E.I.B., S.A., Belgium, for manufacturing sophisticated Vacuum Circuit Breakers up to 33kV, 40kA and up to current rating of 3000Amps. All the above products have been successfully launched in the market and MEI has retained its reputation for quality products ever since its inceptions. The company is supplying to almost all the leading Electricity Boards and undertakings and industrial users through out the country.
COMPANY_PROFILE.DESCRIPTION_NORMAL4: The company is self contained in respect of infrastructure and manufacturing facilities backed up by established Research and Development Division including Computer Circuit Breaker Analyzer, Computer Aided Design Center, Computer Aided planning well equipped testing division and a reputed Tool Room. In the year 1992 the company’s R&D has successfully developed Porcelain Clad Vacuum Circuit Breaker of electrical rating 12kV, 25kA and 1250Amps and successfully launched this product into market.
COMPANY_PROFILE.DESCRIPTION_NORMAL5: MEI’s Product line today, comprises a wide range of High-Voltage circuit breakers, high voltage metal clad switchgears, stator rotor starters, Direct-On-Line and an array of relays and control devices, to name a few. MEI’s strong points according to independent industry observes Wide range of contemporary electrical equipment with extensive areas of application.
COMPANY_PROFILE.DESCRIPTION_NORMAL6: All MEI products carry the hallmark of independent certification from foreign collaborators and CPRI’s at Bhopal and Bangalore. Today, after more than 60 years later , MEI’s products span the globe; Australia, Singapore , Kenya, Kuwait, Ceylon, Burma, Bahrain, Sudan, UAE, Cyprus and many other countries.

VISION.DESCRIPTION_BOLD: MEI is working towards achieving Annul Turnover Target of Rs.75 Crores by 2016-2017. Main Thrust is given on R & D activities to keep ahead of Time in Technological changes and Market requirements.
VISION.DESCRIPTION_NORMAL1: We continue to keep our Quality Standards high by which, reputation of MEI products is well known since seven decades.
VISION.DESCRIPTION_NORMAL2: We are widening our Vendor Base, who are all ISO Certified, This is, to be Competitive in the Market and for Timely Delivery.
VISION.DESCRIPTION_NORMAL3: Our Quality policy is “To achieve Total customer satisfaction by continuous improvement in Product, Corrective and Preventive action on Customer complaints and regular Management Reviews”.

3.NAME: Sri. R. Balachandra
3.DESIGNATION: Dy. Gen.Manager (Material Encharge) and Manager ( Maintenance, Projects)

MANUFACTURING_PROCESS.DESCRIPTION1: The Raw Materials and bought out Items are procured directly from the manufacturers to assure genuineness of the items. All items procured are inspected and tested as per the relevant standards The various materials undergo in-house manufacturing process on various machines.
MANUFACTURING_PROCESS.DESCRIPTION2: In order to achieve the desired quality, all items undergo inspection at all stages of manufacturing Finally 100% Inspection / Tests are carried out before sending them to assembly lines.
MANUFACTURING_PROCESS.DESCRIPTION3: Fabricated parts and tanks are neatly welded and all oil tanks are of leak proof welding. Oil tanks are pressure tested to examine leakage, if any, before they are sent to assembly lines.
MANUFACTURING_PROCESS.DESCRIPTION4: All parts which undergo painting degreased and hot phosphates to avoid corrosion, by 7 Hot Tank treatment before it is finally painted. Even parts which undergo plating are degreased and plated
MANUFACTURING_PROCESS.DESCRIPTION5: Painting consists of one coat of Red Oxide Primer and 2 coats of finish paint (as per the customers requirement). Every stage of sub-assembly is subjected to strict inspection and testing Care is being taken to achieve inter-changeability.
MANUFACTURING_PROCESS.DESCRIPTION6: All fasteners are tightened using torque wrenches and oil leads are tightened to optimum levels. All mechanisms are inspected and tested both mechanically and electrically before effecting dispatch to ensure trouble free service in the field.

PAINTING_PROCEDURE.DESCRIPTION1: All MS items undergo pre-treatment for rust removal and phosphating in a specially created 7 tank plant. The 7 tank plant contains alkahal bath, water bath, acid bath, water bath, phosphating and passivation.
PAINTING_PROCEDURE.DESCRIPTION2: The strength of the both acid and phosphating solution are periodically checked in the laboratory and depending upon the strength of the acid, advice is given to replerish / replace the acid / phosphating solution.
PAINTING_PROCEDURE.DESCRIPTION3: Further all these items are coated with zinc primer red-oxide for prevention of rust and then 2 to 3 coats of finished painting is applied before dispatching the same. Stove enamel painting facility is also available.
PAINTING_PROCEDURE.DESCRIPTION4: The fabricated items and castings which are filled with oil etc. will be subject to leak prevention test by conducting pressure test on the same. Also all the tanks of the Circuit Breakers are subject to pressure testing.

PRODUCTION.DESCRIPTION: The Company has achieved a production turnover of Rs.4064.81 lakhs in terms of Sale value, against the target of Rs.6500.00 lakhs, accounting for 62.54% of the target set.

SALES.DESCRIPTION: The Company has achieved a Sales turnover of Rs.4083.78 lakhs, against the target of Rs.6500.00 lakhs, accounting for 62.83% of the target set. The Company could not achieve Targeted Production and Sales turnover during the year due to Non-Procurement of CT's and PT's as the Supplier had brought a Stay from Honorable High Court of Karnataka. WORKING RESULTS FOR THE YEAR 2016-17: The working results for the year 2016-17 are expected to end up with a Profit of Rs.30.12 lakhs. And the accumulated loss at the year-end would be Rs.35.59 lakhs.

FINANCIAL_POSITION.DESCRIPTION: The working capital management and financial position of the company during the year is satisfactory and the company is regular in paying all the statutory dues.

ORDER_BOOK_POSITION.DESCRIPTION: During the year 2016-17 the company has received the orders worth Rs.6630.26 lakhs and executed orders worth Rs.4083.78 lakhs. The order book position as at 1 st April 2016 was Rs.3006.50 lakhs and the estimated value of orders as on 1st APRIL 2017 is Rs.5552.98 lakhs as detailed in ANNEXURE-1. The company is putting in serious efforts to mobilize the orders required for plant load during the next financial year.

TARGET.DESCRIPTION: The Production and Sales targets for the year 2017-18 are fixed at Rs.6200 lakhs each respectively. The details of Production and Sales targets are indicated in ANNEXURE-2,3 & 4.

MATERIAL_COST.DESCRIPTION: The estimated Material Cost to production during the year 2016-17 works out to be around 68%. The budgeted material cost to production for the year 2017-18 is expected to be around 70%. The details of Product wise and category wise material cost are given in ANNEX.- 5 & 6.

PERSONNEL_COST.DESCRIPTION1: The total  strength of the Employees as on 1-4-2017 is as under :-
PERSONNEL_COST.DESCRIPTION2: The personnel Cost for the year  2016-17 is estimated at Rs.1072.90 lakhs.The total budgeted personnel cost for the year 2017-18 is expected to be at Rs.1121.00 lakhs. The details of Personnel cost are given in ANNEXURE-7 & 8.

VALUE_ADDITION.DESCRIPTION: The value addition per employee is expected to be at Rs.7.75 lakhs per annum as against the personnel cost of Rs.3.31 lakhs per annum per employee.The details are furnished in ANNEXURE-9.

PROFIT_AND_LOSS.DESCRIPTION: The Gross income for the year 2017-18 is budgeted at  Rs.6600.00 lakhs against which an expenditure of Rs.6121.78 lakhs is anticipated. The working results for the year 2017-18 on the above level of turnover is expected to end up with a profit of Rs.478.22 lakhs and accumulated loss being wiped off. The detailed Profit and Loss account together with the schedule of expenses are given in ANNEXURE-12,12A and 12B.

BUDGET_BALANCE_SHEET.DESCRIPTION: The Financial  Position of the Company as per the Budgeted operations is given in the Balance Sheet vide ANNEXURE-11 and 11A.

FUND_FLOW_STATEMENT.DESCRIPTION: The budgeted fund flow statement is furnished in ANNEXURE-13.

BREAK_EVEN_SALES.HEADER: BREAK EVEN SALES FOR THE YEAR 2017-18
BREAK_EVEN_SALES.DESCRIPTION: The break even sales for the  year 2017-18 is estimated at Rs.5120.97 lakhs.  A detailed calculation is furnished in  ANNEXURE-13.

RETROFITTING.TITLE: Retrofitting
RETROFITTING.DESCRIPTION: MEI is expert in retrofitting the other make metal & porcelain clad vacuum circuit breaker due to flexible design and long life mechanism. MEI has Retrofitted the below make.

CERTIFICATES.TITLE: Certificates
CERTIFICATES.DESCRIPTION1: MEI is Known for its Quality and Rugged Design, the MEI products are well accepted in India as well as outside the country. Our products are installed in Australia, Singapore, Kenya, Kuwait, Ceylon, Burma, Bharain, Bangladesh, Sudan, UAE, Cyprus and many other countries.
CERTIFICATES.DESCRIPTION2: The customers list extends to Karnatak Energy Departments like KPTCL, ESCOM’s. Pvt parties like Five star hotels, Cement and paper mills, multistorage and Residential Complex and OEM’s like Kirloskar pneumatics, Ingersoll Rand and Voltas, Water supply boards and Agriculture Sector. The customer base has spread to all over the globe and both Urban and Rural parts of our country.

SUB_HEADER1.HEADER: Applied research is given emphasis in the R & D division of MEI, which has more relevance to the company. The work of the R & D is MEI may be classified broadly into the following groups.
SUB_HEADER1.DESCRIPTION1: Indigenous design & development of products utilizing the available technologies & making maximum utilization of available materials within the country.
SUB_HEADER1.DESCRIPTION2: Design modifications of the products made under overseas as collaboration if customer’s needs and requirements both within & outside the country.
SUB_HEADER1.DESCRIPTION3: Design modifications of products in keeping with the developments of newer materials within the country and also with a view to reduce costs.
SUB_HEADER1.DESCRIPTION5: Peripheral work connected with products developed.
SUB_HEADER1.DESCRIPTION6: Indigenous design & development of products utilizing the available technologies and making maximum utilization of available materials in the country.

SUB_HEADER2.HEADER: Following are the products which have been designed within MEI and which are manufactured and marketed.
SUB_HEADER2.DESCRIPTION1: Low voltage air break star delta starter Type MSDD/NT.
SUB_HEADER2.DESCRIPTION2: Low voltage oil immersed slip ring motor starter Type OSR.
SUB_HEADER2.DESCRIPTION3: Low voltage oil immersed star delta starter Type NSD.
SUB_HEADER2.DESCRIPTION4: Low voltage oil immersed auto transformer starter Type ATS.
SUB_HEADER2.DESCRIPTION5: Low voltage air break heavy duty amperage contactors Type MCA 9 & MCA 11.
SUB_HEADER2.DESCRIPTION6: Liquid rheostat type starters / controllers Type MLS.
SUB_HEADER2.DESCRIPTION7: Low voltage DC shorting switches of 17000 Amps Type MIO16.
SUB_HEADER2.DESCRIPTION11: High current DC shorting switches for use in caustic soda plants.

SUB_HEADER3.HEADER: The Following products have been taken up for development manufacture.
SUB_HEADER3.DESCRIPTION1: 11KV,20KA very compact RMU with draw out VCB’S successfully designed. The proto type shortly being customized with metering facility.
SUB_HEADER3.DESCRIPTION2: 1.11KV,20KA very compact RMU with load break switches for Ring units and VCB for TEE-OFF unit with metering facility.
SUB_HEADER3.DESCRIPTION3: Automatic circuit reclosure for 11KV rural distribution network.
SUB_HEADER3.DESCRIPTION4: Design and Development of 11KV,31.5 KA Vacuum Circuit Breaker.
SUB_HEADER3.DESCRIPTION5: Design and Development of 33KV,750 MVA porcelain clad Vacuum Circuit Breaker.
SUB_HEADER3.DESCRIPTION6: Successfully Retrofitted 11 KV VCB Panels, SF6 panels, MOCB panels of various makes like ABB,SIEMENS,CGI,BHEL,ALSTOM, KIRLOSKAR,VOLTAS,STROMERG,ECE other than MEI make MOCB and BOCB.
SUB_HEADER3.ENDING: R & D in MEI is keeping abreast with the latest technological developments both within the country and abroad. Its staff is actively participating in National seminars, Lectures, etc., and they have attended a number of conferences and symposiums. They have presented papers and have activity participated in the deliberations. MEI was a member of E R A and is also a member of the Indian Standards Institution. The R & D Unit has a separate Library and contributes to a number of journals and periodicals both from within the country and overseas. It is also enlisting the assistance of the Indian Institute of Science, CPRI., etc., for the design and testing of the products.

TESTING_FACILITIES.TITLE: Testing Facilities
TESTING_FACILITIES.DESCRIPTION1: Has the relevant testing instruments for carrying out various Quality Control functions required at different stages of manufacturing Enclosed are the details regarding Electrical Testing facilities and Mechanical Testing facilities available with us.
TESTING_FACILITIES.DESCRIPTION2: All our Quality Control process / procedures have been streamlined and accepted by approved Inspection agents like M/s. CROWN AGENTS & M/s. S G S. Further this has been accepted by independent Government Testing agencies viz., EXPORT INSPECTION AGENCY & INDIAN STATICAL INSTITUTE. As a proof of this certificates issued by the above said authorities shall be furnished on request.
TESTING_FACILITIES.DESCRIPTION3: All the instruments like meters etc., used for manufacturing & Q.C. process are being calibrated periodically (once in a year) by an independent testing & certification agency M/s. CPRI. & EIDC., Bangalore, Mechanical Gauges (standard) are calibrated in house.

DUTIES1.TITLE: 3. Duties
DUTIES1.DESCRIPTION1: The Company incorporated under the companies Act 1956 is a Government of Karnataka Undertaking The company is duty bound to serve the society by manufacture, supply and service of switch Gears and Motor Control Gears to the state Electric city Board, public and private organisations at a comptetive rate with continuous growth and profit to the share holders.
DUTIES1.DESCRIPTION2: ii) THE POWERS AND DUTIES OF ITS OFFICERS AND EMPLOYEES:

POWERS.TITLE: 1. Powers
POWERS.DESCRIPTION: As laid down in various OGCS Circulars Office order and delegation of powers in the Organisatioanal hierarchy.

DUTIES2.TITLE: 2. Duties
DUTIES2.DESCRIPTION: As per the work allotment to the individual office and Employees.

RIA1.TITLE: RTIA-41(b)
RIA1.DESCRIPTION: The Manual as required under The Right to Information Act, 2005 under Section 4(b) of the Act is published with modifications / Amendments for the information of the Public and the same is appended below.

RIA2.TITLE: RTIA2
RIA2.DESCRIPTION1: PROCEDURES FOLLOWED IN THE DECISION MAKING PROCESS INCLUDING CHANNELS OF SUPER VISION AND ACCOUNTABLLITY
RIA2.DESCRIPTION2: The Activities of the company has been clearly bifurcated into various divisions. The duties and responsibilities of each divisions are appended below

MARKETING.TITLE: a. Marketing Division
MARKETING.DESCRIPTION1: The division is headed by Sri Thimmanna, MANAGER, I/c who  is functional head of Marketing Division.
MARKETING.DESCRIPTION2: The duties and responsibilities of the division in brief are as under:-
MARKETING.B: ab    : Submission of quotations to the customers in consultation with the pricing committee and the managing Director /Chairman & Managing Director wherever necessary.
MARKETING.C: ac    : Acceptance of the order received from the customers.
MARKETING.D: ad    : Preparation and publishing of price list for standard products and spares, in consultation with the pricing Committee and the managing Director / Chairman and Manager
MARKETING.E: ae    : Supply of products within the scheduled time of delivery in consultation and continuous contact with the planning, production, Quality Assurance and other divisions.
MARKETING.F: af     : Inviting customers for customers inspection wherever necessary.
MARKETING.H: ah    : Preparation of monthly,quarterly and annual production and dispatch targets in consultation with other Divisions.
MARKETING.I: ai     : Correspondence with the customers,collection of funds receivable from the customers, in consultation with Accounts.
MARKETING.J: aj     : Attention to customer’s complaints and necessary action to minimize customer complaints.
MARKETING.K: ak    : Undertaking servicing at the request /complaint of the customers both free & payable.
MARKETING.L: al     : Continuous contacts with the customers, dealers contractors etc and holding periodical dealers/ customers conference in various cities across the county.

RIA3.TITLE: RTIA3
RIA3.DESCRIPTION1: The materials Division is Headed by Sri.BALACHANDRA, DEPUTY GENERAL MANAGER (MATARIALS)I/C,
RIA3.DESCRIPTION2: The duties and responsibilities of the division in brief are as under:-
RIA3.A: ba    : The Department is responsible for the procurement of quality raw materials and bought out items to the specification of required quantity as per the production programme drawn and on the basis of quarterly/bi- monthly /monthly programmer from the cheapest source observing the KTTP ACT for procurement in a more transparent manner keeping in view the inventory carrying cost and production losses due to lack of Materials in time.
RIA3.B: bb    : Planning of Materials based on the quarterly / bi- monthly production programme.
RIA3.C: bc    : Entering into annual contracts with the suppliers by publishing tender notification for the supply of Materials like copper, wood and other value materials.
RIA3.D: bd    : Releasing tender notification/ Floating enquiries ,comparison of rate received, purchase proposal internal audit, placing it before purchase Committee of / and MD / CMD wherever necessary depending upon the value of the order.
RIA3.F: bf     : Follow up with the suppliers.
RIA3.G: bg    : Receipts, storage of inspected goods and issue of materials to users departments Maintenance of register of inwards goods and stock register. Maintenance of rejection
RIA3.H: bh    : Registration of Vendors and Maintenance of the list of approved vendors.
RIA3.I: bi     : Communication of acceptance or otherwise of the materials supplied to the Company , to the supplier.
RIA3.J: bj     : Collection of materials from Customers/ Transporters Godown.
RIA3.K: bk    : Verification of customers invoice and forwarding the same along with the copy of the inspection report to Finance Dept for payment as per the terms of the purchase order.
RIA3.L: bl     : Disposal of Scrap generated during the production activities.
RIA3.M: bm     : Issue of materials on labour basis and maintenance of material ledger.
RIA3.N: bo     : Identification of non-moving materials, action for usage or disposal of the surplus non-moving stock.
RIA3.O: bp     : Storing accepted materials in pre- determined location with clear identification and maintenance of stock register.
RIA3.P: bq     : Preparation and circulation among user departments the summary of daily receipts of materials.
RIA3.Q: br     : To take all steps to see that the production is not affected on account of non- availability of untimely receipt of materials.

RIA4.TITLE: RTIA4
RIA4.DESCRIPTION1: The Finance Division is Headed by Sri.N. Sriramprasad, Deputy Manager I/c  (Finance and Account).
RIA4.DESCRIPTION2: The duties and responsibilities of the division in brief are as under:-
RIA4.A: ca    : Evaluation of Costs of products, Components and Services.
RIA4.B: cb    : Maintenance of Materials Stock Ledger.
RIA4.C: cc    : Maintenance of the records of Machinery equipments and other moveable property of the company.
RIA4.D: cd    : Evaluation of the value of work in progress.
RIA4.E: ce    : Conduct of Annual Inventory and evaluation of the value of the work in progress for the purpose of taking the same to books of accounts of the subsequent financial year.
RIA4.F: cf     : Preparation of budget and placing it before the Board.
RIA4.G: cg    : Updation of rates of materials in the Market.
RIA4.H: ch    : Support for the preparation of price list by giving cost of products and spares.
RIA4.I: ci     : Evaluation of Material overheads, Administrative overheads, production overheads, Financial overheads and selling and distributing overheads.
RIA4.J: cj     : Control on the expenditure as to whether such expenditure is well within the approved budget.
RIA4.K: ck    : Maintenance of the list of finished goods inventory.
RIA4.L: cl     : Receipt of cheques from the customers and remitting it to the Bank.
RIA4.N: cn    : Payment of salaries and remittance of recoveries made in the salary to the concerned statutory authority.
RIA4.P: cp    : Correspondence with the Government on all the financial matters.
RIA4.Q: cq    : Maintenance of cash section, cash book.
RIA4.R: cr     : Finalisation of books of accounts for the previous financial year and getting it cleared from the statutory auditors and Comptroler and Auditor General.
RIA4.S: cs    : Placing Audited Books of Accounts before the Board and the Annual General Body Meeting.
RIA4.T: ct     : Maintenance of credit and debit balance of all the suppliers and customers.
RIA4.U: cu    : Exercising control over the expenditure and to optimize utilization of funds to the advantage of the company.
RIA4.V: cv    : Activities related to Sales Tax, Excise Duty and Assessment of the same by the appropriate authority.

RIA5.TITLE: RTIA5
RIA5.DESCRIPTION1: The works Department is headed by Sri. S.E.Uddanna , Deputy General Manger (works) I/C.
RIA5.DESCRIPTION2: The duties and responsibilities of the division in brief are as under:-
RIA5.A: da    : Preparation of quarterly / bimonthly / monthly production and dispatch programme in consultation with the production planning and marketing division.
RIA5.B: db    : Production of product and spares as per the work orders raised by production Planning Division within the schedule date .Offering the products and spares to testing and inspection by the quality assurance dept.
RIA5.C: dc    : Despatch of finished goods to the customer destination as per order Acceptance .
RIA5.D: dd    : Duties and responsibility of Manager within the meaning of factories Act.

RIA6.TITLE: RTIA6
RIA6.DESCRIPTION1: The Planning Department is Headed by Sri S.E.Uddanna, Deputy General Manger (Works) I/c.
RIA6.DESCRIPTION2: The duties and responsibilities of the divisions in brief are as under:-
RIA6.DESCRIPTION3: The Inspection department is headed by Sri. V.Manohar, Manger ( Quality Assurance, Tool Room & Testing).
RIA6.A: ea1    : Preparation of quarterly / bimonthly / monthly production and dispatch programmer in consultation with works and marketing divisions.
RIA6.B: ea2    : Release of indents for various components and bought out items on materials divisions for procurement.
RIA6.C: ea3    : Release of work order for the components, sub assembly & the products as per the production programme and order acceptance.
RIA6.D: ea4    : Follow up of progress of work order released.
RIA6.E: ea5    : Release of indents for the manufacture of tools at Tool Room.
RIA6.F: ea6    : Development of time standard for components, sub assly and the products.
RIA6.G: ea7    : Support for make or buy decisions.
RIA6.H: ea8    : Labour and Material details to costing for various components.
RIA6.I: ea9    : Participation in the negotiation with the suppliers and in the pricing and purchase committee.
RIA6.J: ea10  : Preparation of list of finished goods.
RIA6.L: ea12  : Maintenance of component stores and tool cribs and related records.
RIA6.M: ea13  : Participation in pricing / purchase and Tender Scrutiny Committee.
RIA6.N: eb1    : The Inspection of incoming goods other than Electrical goods as per the specification mentioned in the purchase order and segregation of materials into accepted and rejected lost.
RIA6.O: eb2    : The Inspection of shop made components and assemblies as mentioned in the shop work order and drawing supplied and segregation of materials into accepted and rejected lots.
RIA6.P: eb3    : Stage shop floor inspection of components.

RIA7.TITLE: RTIA7
RIA7.DESCRIPTION1: Sri.C.H.Mallikarjuna, Manager (Personnel and Industrial Relation), heads personnel and administration divisions
RIA7.DESCRIPTION2: The duties and responsibilities of the division in brief are as under:-
RIA7.A: fa1    : Recruitment. Presently all recruitment have been banned including recruitment on Compassionate Grounds.
RIA7.B: fa2    : Maintenance and updating of C & R Rules Seniority List Roaster Register, Accident Register, Medicines stock Register, personal Files, Training records, Attendance record and other correspondences with the other divisions and the Government.
RIA7.C: fa3    : Forwarding attendance to finance division for payment of wages and production and dispatch bonus.
RIA7.D: fa4    : Proposal relating to pay fixation Annual Increment, Non-vacancy based promotion, confirmation after probation.
RIA7.E: fa5    : Obtaining CR rating from the HOD`s in the appropriate CR forms for the purpose of sanction of annual increment and confirmation.
RIA7.F: fa6    : Retirement notice Last Pay Certificate, calculation of attendance for the purpose of payment of Gratuity.
RIA7.G: fa7    : Process and forwarding of pension forms to the EPF organisation.
RIA7.H: fa8    : Settlement of dues of the retired/deceased Employee to the legal heirs.
RIA7.I: fa9    : Employees Welfare Activities including House Keeping Ambulance, Uniforms and shoes, and maintenance of Industrial canteen etc.
RIA7.J: fa10  : Acting as a convener of departmental promotion committee.
RIA7.K: fa11  : Correspondences with the recognised unions. Processing of charter of demands and acting as convener of the negotiation committee for examination of charter of demands, negotiation, with the unions, submission of recommendations to the management.
RIA7.L: fa12  : Engagement of Apprentices and casual workmen. All correspondences related to apprentices with the concerned authorities.
RIA7.M: fa13  : Transport and Salvage and Reclamation.
RIA7.N: fb1    : Matters relating to renewal of factory license, submission of annual and half yearly returns to the Director of Factories and Boilers.
RIA7.O: fb2    : Contracts related to Transportation of Goods, Annual preventive maintenance of testing machines, weighing machines, water tank cleaning Security Services, Fax, Photocopier, Duplicating machine, General Insurance service & Courier Service etc.
RIA7.P: fb3    : All legal matters and appointment of legal advisor.
RIA7.Q: fb4    : Proposal for the payment of property tax.
RIA7.R: fb5    : Indenting and issue of stationery to user departments.

RIA8.TITLE: RTIA8
RIA8.DESCRIPTION1: Research & Development, division is headed by Sri M.L.Srinath(Research & Development).
RIA8.DESCRIPTION2: The duties and responsibilities of the division in brief is as under:-
RIA8.A: ga    : Design, Development and launching of new products.
RIA8.B: gb    : Upgrdation of Technology by introduction of new products and existing products.
RIA8.C: gc    : Development of proto- type and getting it type tested at CPRI.
RIA8.D: gd    : Type testing and renewal of Type test certificate periodically.
RIA8.E: ge    : Support for productionising the newly developed product.
RIA8.F: gf    : Providing drawing and Technical product list of new products to the user developments.
RIA8.G: gg    : Maintenance of records and records pertaining to Design and Development.
RIA8.H: gh    : Manufacture, Repair & Maintenance of jigs, fixtures, Moulding & Press Tools

RIA9.TITLE: RTIA9
RIA9.DESCRIPTION1: Engineering Divisions is headed by Sri. B.D Muchundi Asst Manager (Engineering).
RIA9.DESCRIPTION2: The duties and responsibilities of the division in brief are as under:-
RIA9.A: ha    : Bill of materials for evaluating cost against tender.
RIA9.B: hb    : Indenting electrical goods for procurement against various Order Acceptance.
RIA9.C: hc    : Arrangement of drawing wiring diagram for the customers for their approval & for execution for work on the shop floor.
RIA9.D: hd    : Providing drawing for in house use to the user departments against indents.
RIA9.E: he     : Technical liaison with the other divisions.
RIA9.G: hg    : Testing of incoming goods & final products of the Company.
RIA9.H: hh    : Testing of final products before the customer wherever necessary.
RIA9.J: hj    : Preparation of reports and forwarding the same to the Marketing Division
RIA9.K: hk    : Participation in the purchase , pricing and Tender Scrutiny Committee.

RIA10.TITLE: RTIA10
RIA10.DESCRIPTION1: Quality Divisions is headed by Mr. V Manohar, Manager (Quality & Tool Room) who has served more then 30 years to company.
RIA10.DESCRIPTION2: The duties and responsibilities of the division in brief are as under:-
RIA10.A: ia    : Development of Zigs and Fixtures for the regular and new productions activities.
RIA10.B: ib    : Maintaining the measuring instrument list and its calibration monitoring.
RIA10.C: ic    : Inspection of Procured / Incoming material.
RIA10.D: id    : Ensuring the process / routine inspection.
RIA10.E: ie     : Preparation of test certificates wherever it is required.
RIA10.F: if    :  Conduct final inspection before dispatch.
RIA10.G: ig    : Check and ensure lab report reliability for test equipments.
